page.title: 12Knockholt C of E School
page.content: About 90 pupils aged 5-11 years attend the Church of England Primary School. At 9.15am they arrive on bicycle or foot or by car. They begin their day with a spirited talk and a song with meaningful purpose. Each week the Rector takes assembly and teachers and children accompany the singing with guitars, recorders and percussion. The three lady teachers and the headmaster teach English, reading, writing and mathematics. All the children study the Natural and Scientific world they live in and express this in Art, Craft and Music. After their lunch break the children sometimes learn to swim in their own pool and play organised games until home time. The school is lucky to have extensive grounds.
